{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the documents, the muscles that tend to pull the mandible back after bilateral mandibular fracture in the canine region are the genioglossus and anterior belly of digastric muscles. The genioglossus muscle attaches to the central portion of the mandible and can cause the tongue to fall backwards and block the airway. The anterior belly of digastric muscle also attaches to the mandible and can contribute to the displacement of the mandibular segments in the posterior and inferior direction.", "answer_choice": "A"}
